description: TEHRAN - In a phone call on Monday, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi and his Irish counterpart Micheál Martin, discussed the wars in the Gaza Strip and Ukraine as well as the Western-led sanctions on Iran.
title: Iranian, Irish foreign ministers discuss Gaza and Ukraine wars

description: PARIS – Iran’s Amirhossein Alipour and Mahdi Olad won a gold and a silver medal respectively in the Men's Shot Put - F11 of the 2024 Paralympic Games on Monday.
title: Shot putters Alipour, Olad win gold and silver: 2024 Paralympics

description: PARIS – Iran claimed a silver medal in the compound mixed team of the 2024 Paralympic Games on Monday.
title: Iran mixed team takes silver at 2024 Paralympic Games

description: Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya told Al Jazeera that the resistance movement has been ready to sign a ceasefire deal for Gaza, but Netanyahu has prevented that from happening.
title: Hamas official: Netanyahu blocking Gaza ceasefire deal

description: A Palestinian man killed by Israeli forces in Jenin was handed over to paramedics with "torture marks" found on his body, according to health officials.
title: 'Torture marks' found of body of Palestinian killed by Israelis in Jenin

description: The commissioner-general of the UN agency for Palestinian refugees said, across the region, children are starting their new school term at UNRWA facilities, but not in Gaza, as more than “600,000 children are … living in the rubble” due to the war.
title: Seventy percent of UNRWA schools ‘destroyed or damaged’

description: TEHRAN – In a letter to the Jordanian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Office for Strengthening Unity (Daftar-e-Tahkim Vahdat), an Iranian student organization, has urged Jordan to reconsider its ties with Israel, especially in light of the recent developments in Gaza.
title: Iran student association calls on Jordan to reconsider ties with Israel

description: The United Kingdom says it will suspend 30 of 350 arms exports licenses to Israel, citing a “clear risk” they could be used in serious breaches of international humanitarian law.
title: UK announces partial suspension of arms exports to Israel

description: TEHRAN - Arg-e Karim Khan, the iconic citadel in Shiraz, has commenced an international mourning heritage festival, a four-night event celebrating global mourning rituals.
title: Shiraz citadel hosts intl. mourning festival with enthusiastic reception

description: Israeli forces continue to pound the Gaza Strip, killing dozens of Palestinians, including 11 people sheltering at a school in Gaza City and four traveling in a car near Deir el-Balah.
title: 11 killed in Israeli attack on Gaza school

description: Airports, schools, banks and hospitals across Israel have closed, as its largest trade union called for a one-day strike to protest over the government’s failure to secure a hostage deal.
title: Israel shuts down as general strike calls for deal with Hamas

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi has warned that Israel is seeking to push the tension in the region to the “brink of a dangerous crisis” through its continued crimes in the Gaza Strip which has now spread into the West Bank.
title: Israel pushing region to ‘brink of dangerous crisis,’ Iran FM warns the West

description: TEHRAN – The University of Isfahan has named the faculty of mathematics and statistics after Maryam Mirzakhani, the genius mathematician who died of cancer in 2017 when she was only 40.
title: Isfahan faculty of mathematics named after Maryam Mirzakhani

description: TEHRAN- A mourning ceremony commemorating the demise of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and martyrdom of Imam Hassan (AS), the second Shia Imam took place on Sunday night at the Mohammadi Center in Kemps Creek in Sydney, Australia.
title: Mourning ceremony for demise of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) held in Sydney

description: TEHRAN- The value of Iran’s tomato export reached $177 million during the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21), the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA) reported.
title: Iran exports $177m of tomato in 5 months

description: TEHRAN- As announced by Mohammad Rezvanifar, the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA), Iran has exported $19.5 billion of crude oil and fuel oil in the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21).
title: Value of Iran’s oil export hits $19.5b in 5 months

description: TEHRAN- Today, the 28th day of Safar, the second lunar month, marks a somber occasion in the Islamic calendar. Muslims around the world are mourning the passing of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), the final messenger of God, and the martyrdom of Imam Hassan (AS), his grandchild and the second Imam of Shia.
title: Mourning the Prophet's demise: a day of remembrance and grief

description: TEHRAN - Iranian Oil Minister Mohsen Paknejad has appointed Saeed Tavakoli as the Deputy Oil Minister and Head of National Iranian Gas Company (NIGC).
title: NIGC’s new head appointed

description: TEHRAN- As announced by Iran's Power Generation, Distribution, and Transmission Company (known as Tavanir), electricity has been supplied to 20 villages throughout the country since the beginning of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20).
title: Electricity supplied to 20 villages since late March

description: TEHRAN- The value of Iran’s non-oil export increased by 10 percent during the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21), as compared to the same period of time in the past year, the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA) announced.
title: Iran’s non-oil export up 10% in 5 months on year

description: TEHRAN- The value of Iran’s non-oil export increased by 10 percent during the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21), as compared to the same period of time in the past year, the head of the Islamic Republic of Iran Customs Administration (IRICA) announced.
title: Iran’s non-oil export up 10% in five months on year

description: TEHRAN – Approximately 31,000 out-of-school children have resumed education in the past academic year which started on September 22, 2023.
title: Some 31,000 out-of-school children back to education

description: TEHRAN –During a three-day training workshop conducted by the health ministry and the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), eighty experts from the Ministry’s health promotion departments were introduced to social and behavioral change (SBC).
title: Health ministry, UNICEF hold workshop on social, behavioral change

description: TEHRAN - The Global Innovation Index (GII) has ranked Tehran as the world’s 38th-largest science and technology (S&T) cluster this year, down from 35th last year, according to a report released on Tuesday by the UN’s World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO).
title: GII 2024 places Tehran 38th among top 100 science and technology clusters
Echoes of devotion: Iran’s mourning traditions for Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and Imam Hassan (AS)
